summary:
Johan Nieuwenhuize (Oost-Souburg, the Netherlands, 1980) is a Dutch photographer, artist and curator.

In 2006 he received a Bachelor degree in photography from the Royal Academy of Arts, The Hague (KABK) and was granted several working grants by Stroom Den Haag and Mondriaan Fund among others. From August 2011 until March 2015 he was curator and director of Platform57, a platform for site specific contemporary art, which he also initiated.

His work has been shown at the Three Shadows Photography Art Centre in Beijing, De Kabinetten van De Vleeshal in Middelburg, Street Level Photoworks in Glasgow and Fotomuseum Den Haag.
Since 2015 he collaborates with Japanese photographer Shinji Otan. OTANI NIEUWENHUIZE had it’s museum debut at the Dazaifu Tenmangu Shrine Museum in Dazaifu, Japan in 2016. In 2017 Nieuwenhuize was commissioned by NTjong and het Nationale Theater to work on a large photo series and installation work.

His work has been published in NRC M Magazine, YVI Magazine, de Volkskrant and IMA Magazine. In November 2011 he self-published MADE IN CHINA, his second book IMG_ was published by Kehrer Verlag in April 2014. In 2016 Tique art publications issued OTANI NIEUWENHUIZE. 
The work of Johan Nieuwenhuize is represented in permanent collections of Fries Museum, the Dazaifu Tenmangu Shrine Museum, The Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, VUMC, Twynstra Gudde, and the private collections Collectie Reyn van der Lugt, Rotterdam, Collectie Pieter en Marieke Sanders, Haarlem and Collectie de Groen, among others.

He is a member of DuPho and is represented by Art Agent Orange. The projects of Johan Nieuwenhuize are made possible by The Shareholders, Stroom Den Haag and Mondriaan Fund.

Recently he was commissioned by Teylers Museum, Haarlem to create a work about the renovation of Pieter Teylers Huis
Johan Nieuwenhuize lives and works in The Hague, the Netherlands.

treasury_media.title: The Bubble (2018)
treasury_media.description:
Artistic research is the basis of The Bubble. First an extensive photo archive of over 700 images about the experiences of students was created. In collaboration with cognitive- and datascientist Robin van Emden this visual archive was subject to a study into online viewing behaviour.
Big data following from this research is processed into an interactive installation consisting of three large displays.
The Bubble is part of the art collection of The Hague University of Applied Sciences.

treasury_media.title: Audio visual installation Eerst Zien Dan Geloven
treasury_media.description:
Audio visual installation for NTjong and Het Nationale Theater in The Hague, the Netherlands. The installation contains 195 photos, 10 stop motion films and a sound scape with 25 sound clips, made in three houses of worship; a church, a temple and a synagogue.

On display at Theater aan het Spui, The Hague, June 8 – 11, 2017

school.name: Hogeschool van Beeldende Kunsten, Muziek en Dans Den Haag

awards.title: PRO Deo
awards.description:
Non-financial support for activities that are focused on reflection, in-depth exploration and development and dialogue, for the purpose of developing the recipient's artistic practice or strengthening an initiative's substantive art programme.

More info: https://www.stroom.nl/paginas/pagina.php?pa_id=7857830

awards.title: Stipendium for Established Artists
awards.description:
The Stipendium for Established Artists is intended for visual artists who have been professionally active as visual artists for at least four years. The work grant is intended to help artists fund the purchase of materials, work time and services provided by third parties. The grant is meant to enable artists to create new work and to experiment. The grant can be used for all aspects related to the development of new work, such as research, materials, equipment or projects. The grant amount can also be used to accept a commission or take part in exhibitions and events in the Netherlands and abroad.

The aim is to promote the artist’s oeuvre, cultural entrepreneurship and profile, which will hopefully result in the creation of work that can make a meaningful contribution to Dutch contemporary visual art.

More info: https://www.mondriaanfonds.nl/en/application/stipendium-for-established-artists/

awards.title: PRO Premium
awards.description:
The PRO Premium grant is awarded to individual artists with a busy artistic practice who produce high-quality, distinctive work and who have embarked on a phase of targeted intensification, in-depth exploration or acceleration in their career. Recipients can use the PRO Premium grant to take full advantage of this new focus and further develop their practice in terms of depth and progression.

More info: https://www.stroom.nl/paginas/pagina.php?pa_id=7857830

awards.title: Grant International Presentations
awards.description:
IMG_ is a large ongoing photographic project. The series consists of over more then 300 images. Kehrer Verlag published a book of the project and the installation was shown at Street Level Photoworks, Glasgow and Fotomuseum Den Haag among others.
The project was financed by a Project Grant from Stroom Den Haag, a Grant International Presentations from Mondrian Fund and contributions by the Shareholders and the venues who showed the project.

awards.title: Project grant
awards.description:
IMG_ is a large ongoing photographic project. The series consists of over more then 300 images. Kehrer Verlag published a book of the project and the installation was shown at Street Level Photoworks, Glasgow and Fotomuseum Den Haag among others.
The project was financed by a Project Grant from Stroom Den Haag, a Grant International Presentations from Mondrian Fund and contributions by the Shareholders and the venues who showed the project.

projects.title: Just a few Seconds - Art Collection The Hague University of Applied Sciences
projects.description:
The Hague University of Applied Sciences owns a large collection of art works, of which my 2018 project The Bubble is the latest addition. 
I got the opportunity to develop the concept of a publication about the collection, work on the edit of the book and manage the project, in collaboration with a great team of professionals. 

The book not only contains beautiful photographs, texts by art historians and interviews with those involved, but -by means of a participation trajectory- also contains stories and memories of students, former students and employees of the University.

The design of the book is in hands of Welmer Keesmaat and it will be presented the begining of 2021.

projects.title: in times of corona
projects.description: With the project in times of corona I am placing my own images of public space in The Hague in a broader global perspective. The project shows combinations of my own images with #corona images from social media. Commissioned by art centre Stroom Den Haag.

projects.title: Pieter Teylers Huis - photography art project
projects.description:
Pieter Teylers Huis is a project commissioned by Teylers Museum in Haarlem. The museum is housed in the oldest museum building in the world, built for the purpose of being a museum. The house of Pieter Teylers is where it all started. This house is currently not open to the public and has to be renovated.
The upcoming years this project will take place and the museum commissioned me to follow the proces.

projects.title: OTANI NIEUWENHUIZE - Oranda Loci
projects.description: ORANDA LOCI is the new collaborative project by Japanese photographer Shinji Otani and Dutch artist Johan Nieuwenhuize. It focuses on the influence the Dutch have had on the cultural landscape of Japan.

projects.title: Studio Johan Nieuwenhuize
projects.description: For companies and private persons I execute photography assignments.  Clients: het Nationale Theater, NTjong, ProDemos, Ministerie van VWS, De Raad van State, Theater Dakota, Het Nutshuis, Stroom Den Haag

As a Brand Strategist & certified Ambition Coach I create clarity so that people and organizations may grow.
Registered Nurse (with profound human and cultural interest) at Rosa Spier Huis
Interim manager, adviseur, coach, bestuurder culturele sector

projects.title: The Bubble
projects.description:
The Bubble is a work assigned by The Hague University of Applied Sciences in honour of their 30 year anniversary. The school's art committee chose this project to be realized, out of 27 proposals.
 
The Bubble is an artistic research project for which an extensive photo archive about the experiences of students will be created. This visual archive is the basis for a study into online viewing behaviour.
Big data following from this research is processed into a presentation of the photos.
 
The work will be part of the art collection of The Hague University of Applied Sciences, alongside works by Anton Corbijn, Elspeth Diederix, Andreas Gursky, Bertien van Manen and Lawrence Weiner, among others.

projects.title: Eerst zien dan geloven
projects.description:
Assigned by NTjong and Het Nationale Theater in Den Haag, the Netherlands Johan Nieuwenhuize worked on this audio visual installation work from November 2016 until June 2017.
He photographed, filmed and made sound recordings in three houses of worship; a church, a temple and a synagogue.

Theatre makers Els van der Jagt, Khadija Massaoudi and Martijn Klink developed plays on these same locations, using photographs from the series in the decor.

The installation is accompanied by a publication designed by -SYB-.

Audio visual installation with 195 photographs, 10 stop motion films, soundscape with 25 sound clips, made in three places of worship in the Hague, the Netherlands.
Nine projections on triangular wooden elements, 2125x1700x1700xmm / 2375x1900x1900mm / 2625x2100x2100mm.
Exhibition design in collaboration with Berit Piepgras and Hanna Timmers.
Sound design in collaboration with Eric Magnée.
Built by Ruud Brouwer / het Nationale Theater Decoratelier.
Technique Lennert Esser. production Rianne Valstar.

The installation was on display at Theater aan het Spui in The Hague from June 8 – 11, 2017

See also: www.hnt.nl

contributors.headline: Docent, eindwerkbegeleider bij Academie voor Theater en Dans

projects.title: System as Second Skin - Hans Wilschut
projects.description:
The well known Dutch artists Hans Wilschut created a new and semi permanent site specific piece for Platform57; System As Second Skin.

In Hong Kong, Wilschut made a picture of an un-organised system of drainage pipes and electricity cables on the outside of a building. This image was edited in a way it fits the wall of the newly renovated building of Zuid57. In this way Wilschut combines the informal character of society in Hong Kong with the more organised public space of the Netherlands.

The huge photograph of 480 by 955 centimeters follows the extraordinary architecture of the building from 1957 by architect Sjoerd Schamhart. The image covers the wall over the left wing of the building. Because it is printed on a thin foil it follows the structure of the wall and becomes one with it, like a second skin.

System as Second Skin was part of an exhibition with several of Wilschut's works and was subject to numerous educational programs, like the Summer School of 2013. Together with Platform57, Wilschut also curated a one night film programme with works by Zachary Formwalt and Gerard Holthuis.

projects.title: Platform57, initiator and curator
projects.description:
Between 2011 and 2015 Platform57 was a platform for contemporary and site specific art in, on and around the building of Zuid57 in the area of Escamp, The Hague.
Platform57 realised numerous exhibitions and site specific installations:
Inside Out (JR)               Escamp Inside Out
Nadine Stijns                  Floating Population, 2013-2014
Krijn de Koning              untitled, 2013
Harold de Bree               Ruiterstandbeeld Willem II, 2013
Hans Wilschut                 System as second skin, 2013- heden
Maurice Bogaerts          The Apartment, 2013
Berndnaut Smilde        Nimbus, 2012
Valerie van Leersum    Project Oostbroek, 2012
Ibrahim R. Ineke            Bring me the head of Roy Lichtenstein, 2012
Niels Post                         On Spam, 2012 -heden
Alette Wttewaal             Cubes, 2012
Wolfgang Bittner, Lyndsey Housden, Yoko Sayama en Jeroen Uyttendaele  PLANE SCAPE, 2012

projects.title: HAACS Architecture Magazine
projects.description: HAACS is a platform for anything in the field of architecture in The Hague. This magazine is issued quarterly and reports on the recent developments and offers a platform for debate about architecture.

contributors.headline: What does it mean to be human?

Projectarchitect bij Kraaijvanger Architects Rotterdam - met ervaring in nieuwbouw en transformaties - circulair ontwerpen - sector onderwijs, overheid, zorg, woningbouw en multi-tenant - D&B, DBMO processen

projects.title: Ruiterstandbeeld Willem II - Harold de Bree
projects.description: Ruiterstandbeeld Willem II was a site specific installation by Harold de Bree for the square of the building of Zuid57. The installation shows a close to nature copy of the pedestal of the statue of king Willem II, which is originally situated in the centre of The Hague. This wooden version suggests that a mob tore down the statue. In his exhibition De Bree showed several suggestive works, from fake but close to nature car bombs, to automatic guns. After the exhibition the installation piece on the square became a semi permanent work and was first removed in June 2013.

projects.title: The Apartment  -  Maurice Bogaert / Untitled - Maurice Bogaert & Mathijs Lieshout
projects.description:
In 2011 Maurice Bogaert wins the BNG Workspace project prize with his project The Apartment. 
This installation is based on the camera movents in the film Repulsion by Roman Polanski. The work is a chain of maquettes with ever changing perspectives. By walking through the installation and having to make turns to view al the rooms, the viewer becomes the camera. In collaboration with Filmhuis Den Haag, the project was shown at Platform57.

Next to his large installation, Boagaert made a smaller room filling installation at Platform57; Untitled. This work is a collaboration with Mathijs Lieshout and was also shown at Re: Rotterdam. Untitled is a large installation with two sides. One side is a seemingly chaotic installation of wood, once you step through a window you enter a clean white room.

The side programme consisted of a film screening (in collaboration with Filmhuis Den Haag) and artist talks with Maurice Bogaert and Mathijs Lieshout.

contributors.headline: Producer and programmer in short film and filmrelated arts
Experienced Technology Leader | Strategic Product Visionary | Innovation Catalyst

projects.title: Nimbus - Berndnaut Smilde
projects.description: Especially for Platform57 Berndnaut Smilde created a work from his successful and ongoing series Nimbus. In December 2012 the artist made a Nimbus cloud before a live audience. In his exhibition also other works from his young oeuvre were shown. BBC and Discovery visited Platform57 for interviews and numerous art magazines and newspapers published articles on the work.

contributors.headline: Marketingcommunicatie specialist bij Amare - Den Haag

projects.title: Project Oostbroek - Valerie van Leersum
projects.description: Artist Valerie van Leersum executed research into her family history. Part of her family finds its origin at a former farm in Escamp, in the south-west of The Hague. This is the area where also Platform57 is situated. Her research resulted in the large site specific installation she made for Platform57 in the old gym of the building and on the square of Zuid57. The installation tells her family history by the means of floor plans, models and abstract version of objects found during her research into the old farm of her family.

projects.title: Selected drawings - Thijs Ebbe Fokkens
projects.description: Thijs Ebbe Fokkens showed a wide selection of his work at Platform57; drawings, silk screen prints and installation pieces. Eye catcher of the exhibition was his work Titls TK 3D. The large installation of wood on top of the entrance of the building of Zuid57 attracted attention from most visitors of the building. During the exhibition Fokkens held a lecture on his work.

projects.title: Bring me the head of Roy Lichtenstein - Ibrahim R. Ineke/ On Spam - Niels Post
projects.description: Platform57 invited artists Niels Post and Ibrahim R. Ineke to create new site specific work for the building of Zuid57. Ibrahim R. Ineke created a large comic strip stretching several windows. Niels Post made his largest work from his ongoing series On Spam until then. It consists of adhesive letters on the windows of the old gym of the building. The work shows a line form the e-mail spam filter of the artist. It got a permanent character and in 2015 it is still visible. An artist talk with both Post and Ineke was held in the studio of Theater Dakota.

projects.title: Jaarbrochure Theater Dakota
projects.description: Serie portretten van theatermakers die tijdens het seizoen 2012-2013 een serie voorstellingen spelen in Theater Dakota. De serie foto's is gemaakt op lokatie in gebouw Zuid57, met steeds een andere achtergrond. De portretten zijn geplaatst naast interviews met de theatermakers en vormen zo de rode draad in de brochure. De brochure werd vormgegeven door Carrie Zwarts en Sybren Kuiper. De redactie was in handen van Sytze Schalk.

projects.title: Cubes - Alette Wttewaall
projects.description: The Platform57 exhibition 'Cubes' showed recent works by artist Alette Wttewaall. The artist creates dioramas with an art historical atmosphere, using so called road kill. From found dead animals, she creates new 'species'. The sculptural pieces were on display in the foyer of the building Zuid57 causing numerous discussions.

projects.title: Plane Scape
projects.description:
Plane Scape was the first exhibition of Platform57. It is a spectacular multi media installation piece by artists Wolfgang Bittner, Lyndsey Housden, Yoko Seyama and Jeroen Uyttendaele. 
An educational programme for kids and an exhibition with the results of this programme were organised. The side programme also contained a lecture by the artists and a concert by Hans van der Maas.

company.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
Since 2018 I am advising the Art Collection of The Hague University of Applied Sciences on their policy, vision and programme. 

In collaboration with teachers and students I made the publication about the collection, Just a Few Seconds.

Together with social designer Jennefer Verbeek I developed the Art Commission 2022. An extensive participation project with 1300 participants helped us get input from students and eventuaully resulted in a new artwork by Bram de Jonghe.
profile_positions.title: curator and advisor at the art collection of the Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description:
The relationship between photography and memory plays an important role in my work. How can photography trigger us to associate freely or recall events, in which way can it access our memories or even replace a memory? 

In my work I loosely use neuro-scientific theories and different photographic approaches to explore various aspects of the subject. Three pillars are important in every project; the concept, the photography and the presentation. In different projects the emphasis is placed on a different pillar. One project stresses the conceptual, in another the installation of the work is most important for exploring the subject matter. I adjust my way of working accordingly and seek different types of collaborations with other artists and scientists. Collaboration broadens my scope and deepens my work.

With my photographic work and installations I aim to address the memory of the viewer, make them associate freely and recall their own memories. My work is not about what is, but about what can be.
profile_positions.title: Photographer / artist / curator

profile_positions.description:
Between 2011 and 2015 Platform57 was a dynamic platform for visual art in the building of Zuid57 in the south of The Hague.
The program consisted of exhibitions, lectures, film screenings and workshops. The starting point of the program was site specific installation art. Every project took on a different location within, around or on top of the building Zuid57. Platform57 initated projects with Berndnaut Smilde, Krijn de Koning and Hans Wilschut, among many others

Platform57 was initiated by Johan Nieuwenhuize, in close collaboration with Berit Piepgras. Later on Hester van Kranendonk, Nadine Stijns, and Thomas Vroege briefly worked on the project. The team was extended with Anjuli van Romondt, Beleke Bagchus, Jennefer Verbeek, Robin van Emden, Sandra Sholtes and Simone Noordermeer.
profile_positions.title: Curator

profile_positions.description: Coaching a group of graduation students towards their final exam. Discussing assignments and self initiated photography projects. The group contains students who work within different fields of photography.
profile_positions.title: Coach graduation projects

profile_positions.description: Teaching of photography, Courses level 1 and 2. Developing personal photography projects and exhibitions, organizing educational photography excursions with and for students
profile_positions.title: Teacher in photography

profile_positions.description: Paradox creates projects in photography and media related arts. The interaction between social, economic and technological change is central to the thematic projects developed. Alongside these projects, other activities of Paradox include travelling exhibitions, traditional and interactive publishing and organising workshops and symposiums. Paradox does not program in its own exhibition space, but realises projects at different locations, in collaboration with various partners.
